strings:
<se_low>Yangus: That door's pretty serious, eh?
It sorta screams, ‘STAY OUT OR ELSE!’
<se_low>Yangus: Wot wiv that an' the funny maze back there, this place is a bit odd, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: It's strange, but it don't feel like we only just met that Chen Mui bloke.
<se_low>Yangus: I wonder where Munchie's got to, anyway.

<se_low>Yangus: It's weird that 'e just run off when we got 'ere.
First time 'e's done that, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: Fancy a mouse bein' able to open a door us 'umans couldn't, though!
Made me feel a bit daft, really.
<se_high>Jessica: Well, I have to say I feel like we've come to the right place.

<se_high>Jessica: I mean, we passed through that weird labyrinth into this huge open space...!
It's like we're in another world!
<se_high>Jessica: By the way, doesn't something about Chen Mui strike you as a bit...I don't know, odd?
<se_high>Jessica: He says he's here to show us around the village, but it sounds like he's been away for a really long time.

<se_high>Jessica: And he happened to arrive JUST when we did?
How did he time things so perfectly?
<se_high>Jessica: Chen Mui looks like a simple old man, but I suspect there's more to him than meets the eye.

<se_high>Jessica: How on earth was our little Munchie able to open the gate!?
How is that even possible?
<se_low>Yangus: I've been thinkin' for ages that 'e weren't no normal mouse. Actin' a bit like a monster now, if you ask me. Showin' 'is true colours.
<se_def>Angelo: I think his occasional fire-breathing was already fairly monstrous, but still...

<se_def>Angelo: He's run on a long way ahead.
Shouldn't we go after him?
<se_high>Jessica: <Cap><hero>, I know it's a bit late for this, but...what exactly is Munchie!?

<se_high>Jessica: He can breathe fire.
Okay, fine, I can deal with that.<page>Jessica: But then he somehow unlocks a huge gate that none of us could budge...
There's no way he's a normal mouse!
<se_high>Jessica: I can't believe it didn't strike me as odd before!
<se_def>Angelo: Do you really think we have time to come all the way here when we should be taking care of Rhapthorne?
<se_def>Angelo: This is a bit extreme even for one of your detours, <hero>.

<se_def>Angelo: It almost makes me feel respect for you, rather than my usual irritation.
Almost.
<se_def>Angelo: I had hoped that these Dragovians would be quite special. It was something about their name. But they're a bit of a sorry bunch, really.
<se_def>Angelo: I wish we hadn't bothered coming all this way now.

<se_def>Angelo: So these people are part dragon and part human?
They seem fairly normal to me, apart from looking like they're wearing weird earrings...

<se_def>Angelo: I suppose I expected them to be a bit more overtly abnormal, you know?
I mean, nothing else in this place is normal.

<se_def>Angelo: Anyway, the door's open now.
We'd better go on in and see what's in store for us.
<se_low>Chen Mui: I must ask the Elders to explain why the Sanctuary has fallen into such a sad state!

<se_low>Chen Mui: The Council of Elders must be in session now.
Let us go to them. They meet in the largest building in the Sanctuary.

<se_low>Chen Mui: I expect the existence of the Dragovian race came as something of a surprise?
Yes, yes, I quite understand.

<se_low>Chen Mui: Life is full of surprises.
For my part, I never expected humans to find their way through the labyrinth to the Sanctuary.
<se_low>Yangus: We'd better go to that Heavenly Dais place quick, an' fight that Dragovian Lord bloke.
<se_low>Yangus: Then those Elders who were so 'orrible about us will 'ave to eat their words!

<se_low>Yangus: Right then! We've 'ad a good rest, so it's time to go an' fight that Dragovian Lord bloke.
I'm as ready as I'll ever be!

<se_high>Jessica: The Dragovians are getting weaker by the minute.
Time is running out.
We have to do something!
<se_high>Jessica: I realise some of them are a little unfriendly, but I can't just walk away from people who are suffering.
<se_high>Jessica: Chen Mui wouldn't tell us anything.

<se_high>Jessica: I suppose it can't be helped at the moment.
First things first. Let's confront the Lord of the Dragovians and save this village!
<se_def>Angelo: In the past, I'd have looked at people in trouble like this and taken no notice.
<se_def>Angelo: But now I feel like we have to do whatever we can to help them...
<se_def>Angelo: It feels weird hearing myself say something like that. Seems a sabrecat can change his spots, after all.
<se_def>Angelo: Apart from Chen Mui, these Dragovian people aren't the friendliest bunch we've ever met.

<se_def>Angelo: Part of me almost wonders why we're bothering...
No, I don't mean that.<page>Angelo: Maybe I just got out of bed on the wrong side.
They deserve our help, despite their rudeness.

<se_def>Angelo: ...Hm. I'm not normally this agreeable.
Maybe I've been around you too long, <hero>!?
<se_low>Chen Mui: In his dragon form, the Lord of the Dragovians will undoubtedly be the most powerful adversary you have ever faced.

<se_low>Chen Mui: But I believe that you can overcome any obstacle.
I have faith that you will exceed my expectations.
<se_low>Chen Mui: For I know that you have defeated more than your fair share of powerful adversaries in the past.
<se_low>Yangus: So Dragovians really can turn into dragons, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: I wondered if the old man was just pullin' our legs. I mean, they all look 'uman to me...
<se_low>Yangus: I'm lookin' forward to seein' 'ow big that Dragovian Lord bloke is now!
<se_low>Yangus: Some o' them Elders seem to know a thing or two about you, eh, guv?
<se_low>Yangus: Trust you to 'ave people knowin' about ya even in another world!
<se_high>Jessica: The Dragovians are being drained of their energy, their very life-force.

<se_high>Jessica: And now that we know why, we can't just leave them like this!
Let's do something about that Lord of theirs!

<se_high>Jessica: Why, exactly, would the Lord of the Dragovians carry out such a dangerous ceremony?
He put the lives of his subjects at risk.
<se_high>Jessica: And even if it wasn't risky, don't you think abandoning your human form would be pretty inconvenient? I just can't understand it.
<se_def>Angelo: Just as I thought. I knew as soon as we heard about that Lord of the Dragovians chap, you'd end up putting our names down to fight him.

<se_def>Angelo: ...Sorry. I'm not trying to blame you.
You could hardly have refused.
<se_def>Angelo: Huh. I seem to be getting more understanding in my old age.
<se_def>Angelo: I can't help feeling that we're going to get roped into doing something we'd rather not be involved in, if we stick around.

<se_def>Angelo: I've probably mentioned before that my premonitions tend to come true.
Let's hope I'm wrong this time.

<se_low>Yangus: (Yawn!)
I've stuffed meself to the gills today and now I'm just about ready for bed!<page>Yangus: Ooh, there's nuffin like a nice long kip after a bellyful o' grub! (Yawn!)
Smashin'!
<se_low>Yangus: So Dragovians really can turn into dragons, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: I wondered if the old man was just pullin' our legs. I mean, they all look 'uman to me...
<se_low>Yangus: I'm lookin' forward to seein' 'ow big that Dragovian Lord bloke is now!
<se_high>Jessica: Do you have any idea why these people might know about you, <hero>?

<se_high>Jessica: You do!? Why didn't you tell us earlier!?
We wouldn't have wasted so much time thinking about it!

<se_high>Jessica: I didn't think so.
You said before that you don't remember much about your childhood.
<se_high>Jessica: The Dragovians are being drained of their energy, their very life-force.

<se_high>Jessica: And now that we know why, we can't just leave them like this!
Let's do something about that Lord of theirs!
<se_def>Angelo: Sounds like Chen Mui was quite an important chap here, doesn't it?
<se_def>Angelo: He and King Trode really go to show how you can't judge a book by its cover.
<se_def>Angelo: Just as I thought. I knew as soon as we heard about that Lord of the Dragovians chap, you'd end up putting our names down to fight him.

<se_def>Angelo: ...Sorry. I'm not trying to blame you.
You could hardly have refused.
<se_def>Angelo: Huh. I seem to be getting more understanding in my old age.
<se_low>Chen Mui: My humble abode is the two-storey dwelling located at the edge of the Dragovian Sanctuary.

<se_low>Chen Mui: You must be tired from your long journey.
Why don't you come and stay with me for the night, as my honoured guests?
<se_low>Yangus: So we get an 'ole new practice ground for completin' them trials, eh? Nice. ...Only, 'ow d'ya get into it?
<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose by ‘a land beneath a blanket o' white’ 'e meant Orkutsk, did 'e? Was there descendants o' the great sages over that way, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose this place is like yer 'ometown
really, guv.

<se_low>Yangus: I know ya don't remember, but you was born 'ere.
So maybe ya feel a kinda connection to the place?
<se_low>Yangus: I thought as much. That sorta feelin' sticks wiv ya, even if yer memory don't.

<se_low>Yangus: ...Oh, right.
Well, I s'pose Trodain Castle is where ya really feel at 'ome, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose it'll take people a while to get back to normal, even wiv the Dragovian Lord bloke back to 'is 'uman form.

<se_low>Yangus: Still, little by little, eh?
They'll get back on their feet eventually.
<se_high>Jessica: Now that we've completed all of the Dragovian Trials, I don't really see why we need to come here any more.

<se_high>Jessica: Or are you feeling a bit homesick?
I'd totally understand, if that were the case.
<se_high>Jessica: Speaking of which, maybe I should pay Alexandria a visit, too...

<se_high>Jessica: What a story! So the boy who was expelled from the village grew up to return and save it.
Talk about poetic justice!

<se_high>Jessica: Now I finally understand what the Lord of
the Dragovians was getting at before.
That was his whole point.
<se_def>Angelo: Even with everything that's happened, I doubt that humans and Dragovians will suddenly become the best of friends.
<se_def>Angelo: After all these years of mistrust and isolation, it'll take a while to understand each other and bridge the gap.

<se_def>Angelo: Maybe I should start the ball rolling and get acquainted with a nice Dragovian girl... Angelo, the Ambassador of Love, at your service!<page>Angelo: This is how we humans do things down below...
<se_def>Angelo: Even with everything that's happened, I doubt that humans and Dragovians will suddenly become the best of friends.
<se_def>Angelo: After all these years of mistrust and isolation, it'll take a while to understand each other and bridge the gap.

<se_def>Angelo: Maybe I should start the ball rolling and get acquainted with a nice Dragovian girl... Angelo, the Ambassador of Love, at your service!<page>Angelo: This is how we humans do things down below...

<se_low>Chen Mui: I am so pleased that you have finally been accepted by the Dragovians, <hero>.
You have made an old man very happy.

<se_low>Chen Mui: I would not give up a moment of the time we've spent together, travelling as boy and mouse.<page>Chen Mui: You have done me great honour.
I am very proud of you.
<se_low>Yangus: That banquet we 'ad 'ere before really did it for me. Ya can't beat eatin' yer own weight in cheese of an evenin'!

<se_low>Yangus: Aaah! Just thinkin' about it's got me droolin' again!
I want cheese! Gimme cheese!
<se_low>Yangus: So you're Chen Mui's grandson? Which means you're 'alf Dragovian? But you're also one o' the Argonian royal family...!?

<se_low>Yangus: I just can't get me 'ead 'round it!
It's all way too confusin' for me.

<se_def>Angelo: I always knew there was something a bit special about you, <hero>.
I could see it the moment we met.
<se_def>Angelo: Not that even I imagined you'd have both Dragovian AND royal blood in your veins! To have one is fortunate, to have both is bad manners!

<se_high>Jessica: Wait a minute! This means... No!
<Cap><hero> and Prince Charmless are actually related!
<se_high>Jessica: I think I've just discovered something I'd rather have remained blissfully unaware of!
<se_low>Yangus: Now I finally understand why you're so much wiser than yer years, guv.
<se_low>Yangus: People wiv their own struggles can always see the same in other people. You can understand wot they're goin' through, like.
<se_low>Yangus: It makes me quite tearful just thinkin' about wot you've 'ad to deal wiv, guv.
<se_high>Jessica: According to Chen Mui, <hero> was born right here in this very house.

<se_high>Jessica: It's funny.
The minute I heard that, the place started to feel more comfortable.

<se_high>Jessica: I never would have imagined that our little Munchie was actually Chen Mui in disguise!
That just blew my mind!

<se_high>Jessica: No wonder he can breathe fire like that!
It's only natural, he's a Dragovian!
<se_high>Jessica: But now I'm wondering if he really needs cheese to do it! I'm starting to think he uses that as an excuse.
<se_def>Angelo: It must have been difficult for the staff here, what with their master disappearing for nearly twenty years.
<se_def>Angelo: Then finally coming home and leaving again within the space of a few days!
<se_def>Angelo: It's a miracle that this house is still standing, in my opinion.

<se_def>Angelo: You know that story Chen Mui told us before?
Did you notice that he was the only one drawn in a flattering way!?
<se_def>Angelo: Honestly! Who'd have thought an old man like him would be so vain!?

<se_low>Chen Mui: If you ever want to hear my story again, just open the chest.
That's where I keep my storytelling set.
<se_high>Red: You sure about openin' them doors? They don't look much like they wanna be opened, do they?
<se_high>Red: Well, 'e's certainly got an 'aircut ya can't forget in an 'urry, eh? ...Actually, ya know wot? It kinda reminds me o' summat else. A monster or summat, was it?
<se_high>Red: That mouse o' yours ain't showin' itself, eh? Has it run off before, 'as it?
<se_high>Red: Blimey, that mouse is either super strong, or 'andy wiv a lock pick! ...I dunno wot just 'appened, but I ain't gonna think about it too much.
<se_high>Red: Anyway, 'owever it 'appened, the doors are open now, so let's get crackin'.
<se_low>Morrie: Ah ha ha! The doors that say, ‘Show me your GUSTO!’ Allora, we will open them, ay? We have the GUSTO and the PASSION in the spades!
<se_low>Morrie: The old man has the unpeckable timing, ay? He is there to show us the way as soon as we arrive at the villaggio.
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe he is watching us from somewhere, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: You don't wanna take a walk here if you have too much to drink, ay? You fall a long ways down. Tails over the heads, as they say, uh?
<se_low>Morrie: Allora! The doors are open without us musting to use too much GUSTO, ay? Now it is time to take the first steps into a new world!
<se_high>Red: I ain't usually one for doin' others a good turn when there's nuffin' in it for me, but...
<se_high>Red: Well, since I've been trav'llin' round wiv you lot, some'ow I just can't walk away when I see someone in trouble. I dunno wot's got into me.
<se_high>Red: Who d'ya reckon's tougher then, eh? The Lord o' Darkness, or the Lord o' the Dragovians?
<se_high>Red: He calls 'imself the Dragovian Lord actually, don't 'e? Either way, 'e sounds like a tough customer.
<se_low>Morrie: A battaglia with the most powerful dragon...? Ah ha ha, si! It gets the blood flowing, ay? It makes you feel ALIVE!
<se_low>Morrie: We help the Dragovian people and show off our GUSTO at the same time, ay? Ah ha ha! Two stones with one bird!
<se_low>Morrie: Si, maybe some of these Dragovians are not so friendly, but we must still try to help them, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Helping the people in need is one of the most noble things a man can do.

<se_high>Red: So this lot get to choose if they're gonna be 'uman or dragon when they get up in the mornin', eh? Blimey, that'd be all right. It'd
make defeatin' monsters a cinch, that's for sure.
<se_high>Red: Bit funny 'ow this lot around 'ere seem to know you, ain't it? Somefin' don't add up there.
<se_low>Morrie: Ah ha ha, more lives to save! Maybe you are too much nice, ay, ragazzo? Maybe everyone thinks you are soft to touch!
<se_low>Morrie: But you will not hear the grumbling from me. Because fighting to save the lives is Morrie Mozzarella's raisin to live!
<se_low>Morrie: Ah ha ha! Si, I was right to believe in you, ragazzo! You are a famous celebrità every place you go, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: ......Wait. You have not come to this world before, si? So how are they knowing who you are?
<se_high>Red: Well, I must say I'm impressed wiv the 'ospitality. Puttin' us up like this is pretty generous, eh?

<se_high>Red: Bit too generous, maybe. I'm startin' to wonder if that smell I'm gettin' is rat, in fact.
...Still, s'pose it beats 'avin' to rough it outside.

<se_high>Red: So this lot get to choose if they're gonna be 'uman or dragon when they get up in the mornin', eh? Blimey, that'd be all right. It'd
make defeatin' monsters a cinch, that's for sure.
<se_low>Morrie: .........UWAAARRRGH!
<se_low>Morrie: Ah! Scusi, scusi! I am dead on my toes, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: I think maybe I must get some repose.
<se_low>Morrie: Ah ha ha, more lives to save! Maybe you are too much nice, ay, ragazzo? Maybe everyone thinks you are soft to touch!
<se_low>Morrie: But you will not hear the grumbling from me. Because fighting to save the lives is Morrie Mozzarella's raisin to live!
<se_high>Red: Right, we've done our bit. We've shown 'em wot we 'umans are made of. Now it's down to the Dragovians to sort 'emselves out an' stop bein' so prejudiced.
<se_high>Red: I mean, no one's expectin' it to be all smiles straight away, but if we can't all get along a bit better, wot's <hero>'s mum and dad died for, eh?
<se_high>Red: Right, we've done our bit. We've shown 'em wot we 'umans are made of. Now it's down to the Dragovians to sort 'emselves out an' stop bein' so prejudiced.
<se_high>Red: I mean, no one's expectin' it to be all smiles straight away, but if we can't all get along a bit better, wot's <hero>'s mum and dad died for, eh?

<se_low>Morrie: Allora! It was no walk in the dark, ay, but we made it true! We have completed the trials of
the Dragovian Lord!
<se_low>Morrie: There is never an end in the quest to find the ultimate POWER, but this must be <endash> How do you say it? <endash> an importante milerock, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Time for celebrazioni! The Dragovian crisi is over. The people are back from the drink!
<se_low>Morrie: Everything will be fine. The Dragovians are your people, ay, ragazzo? I believe they will see eyes to eyes with us humans now.
<se_high>Red: This lot's lackeys know 'ow to cook an' clean, eh? Blimey, I'm jealous.
<se_high>Red: Why'd I 'ave to end up wiv a couple o' good-fer-nuffin' layabouts at my gaff, eh? Maybe I'll poach meself some replacements from 'ere...
<se_high>Red: I dunno, the 'ole thing's just a bit too ‘out there’, ain't it?
<se_high>Red: But I s'pose if ya can't remember nuffin', <hero>, we just 'ave to take the old bloke's word for it, eh?
<se_high>Red: Kinda seems like 'e's paintin' 'imself as the only decent bloke in town, though, dunnit, wiv that fancy puppet show of 'is. I think I'll take it all wiv a pinch o' salt meself.
<se_low>Morrie: If the Dragovians like the cheese, where are all the cows, ay? Or the goats? How do they get their hands on the goods?
<se_low>Morrie: Or maybe the Dragovian cheese is made from something else? Maybe I keep my last name to myself in this place, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: You have had many trials and triangulations in your life, ay, ragazzo? But now, you have us! We are all here for you.
<se_low>Morrie: Whenever something is making you sad, you come to Morrie. I give you my GUSTO in a grizzly bear hug, ay? Man to man!
